page.title: 15HISTORIC HOME MINCHINHAMPTON
page.content: Amberley Court was a monastery. The earliest date on the house is 1604. From the evidence found we know it is not an ancestral home. {c.1870}Owned by Mr. Whitehead and left to his widow. {1894}Sold by Rebecca Whitehead to William Davies for Â£3,900 (inc. Farm). {1923}William Davies died and left Amberley Court in trust to his wife. {1925}The farm and house were sold separately to Mr. Hine-Haycock and someone else. {1936}Walter Craddock retired from India and for Â£3,500 bought Amberley Court etc. minus the farm. {1952}His wife died and he sold Amberley Court etc.for Â£9,275 to Mr. Guthrie. {1952-1953}He split the house in two and then the stables, the lodge and the house were sold separately.
